proactivePopup.subHeadingText: Learn how tech leaders are integrating AI into apps, securing complex networks, and more.

relatedBlades.title: AI governance starts with data governance
relatedBlades.copy: Governing the use of AI in the enterprise is essential for reducing risks. Because AI depends on data, AI governance must start with data governance — strategies for improving data integrity, preventing data loss, controlling access to AI models, and complying with data localization rules are crucial for protecting your business and maximizing the benefits of AI.

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - AI governance starts with data governance - Image

features.title: Balancing data sovereignty and AI
features.description: Organizations need ways to leverage AI without letting data cross geographical borders. Unless they can control where models run and how models are updated, they risk costly regulatory violations

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Balancing data sovereignty and AI - Image

features.title: Preparing for the future of AI in cyber security
features.description: In 20 years, AI will reshape our world considerably. But too many organizations are focused exclusively on what AI can do today —  to make the most of AI in the future, organizations need to build a long-term strategy and start modernizing security now

features.title: Implementing controls for government use of AI
features.description: AI shows potential to address complex societal challenges, but agencies must balance innovation with safeguarding citizens' interests as they navigate this emerging landscape and combat shadow AI

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Implementing controls for government use of AI - Image

features.title: CTOs guide on AI-assisted development
features.description: Technology leaders are eager to explore AI-assisted development to enhance efficiency and accelerate results — 8 best practices for managing the risks of AI integration

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - CTOs guide on AI-assisted development - Image

features.title: The state of cloud security
features.description: Developing resilient, forward-looking security strategies will become more important to explore the complex world of cloud security and realize its full potential while minimizing risks to businesses

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - The state of cloud security - Image

features.title: AI's role in reinventing the customer experience
features.description: Brands that offer personalization see a 40% increase in revenue. Nan Guo, SVP of Engineering at Zendesk shares how she utilizes AI to personalize the consumer and employee experience — while adhering to the principle of security-by-design

features.title: Enhance cyber security and build resilience
features.description: Incidents like last year's record-breaking DDoS attacks and recent high-profile breaches underscore the need for organizations to be fully engaged in their current cyber security efforts — 4 key initiatives to help balance today's threats with the evolving landscape

features.title: A digital native mindset to cyber security
features.description: Digital natives are taking advantage of Zero Trust and leading a change in cyber security — here are the top 5 benefits they are experiencing.

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - A digital native mindset to cyber security - Image

features.title: ChatGPT impersonators reveal security vulnerability
features.description: With popularity comes risks — Shadow AI multiplies the risks of Shadow IT with the surge in fraudulent and malicious applications designed to infiltrate and steal data

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - ChatGPT impersonators reveal security vulnerability - Image

features.title: Can AI find vulnerabilities?
features.description: Why AI is a double-edged sword when it comes to security and how to future-proof against vulnerability exploits

features.title: Overcoming the challenges of data sovereignty
features.description: More than 100 countries have enacted laws aimed at protecting the privacy of their citizen's personal information—and that's a good thing. However, complying with these laws can pose serious challenges to global businesses

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Overcoming the challenges of data sovereignty - Image

features.title: Ideas for using generative AI safely
features.description: New security threats rise to the surface with every transformative technology. Each time, the industry has responded by tightening security, protocol, and process —  the same will happen with AI

features.title: AI is here: How can businesses stay secure?
features.description: AI will no doubt will be a game-changer in our hyper-connected digital world. As organization adopt AI into their operations, they must also be proactive to secure themselves from the potential of AI-run cyberattacks

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - AI is here: How can businesses stay secure? - Image

features.title: Protecting data from AI
features.description: When used without being mindful of the limitations and risks AI tools present — they can not only hamper the development process but also cause harm to the organizations using them

features.title: Should you ban employee use of AI?

features.description: There is incredible opportunity in using AI, but this technology also presents challenges that may be addressed through cyber security

features.title: The Internet is the new corporate network
